{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3622038,"name":"Drew B.","username":"Drew_B","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/drew_b/{size}/194417_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-12T17:37:39.831Z","cooked":"

I’ve had a few teams reach out and ask about receiving Onshape Associate Certification Exam voucher codes for their students, so it’s worth highlighting here as well.

As part of PTC’s Virtual Kit of Parts donation this year, we’ve set up a request form for teams to receive up to 5 Onshape Associate Exam vouchers. These can be used by any member of the recipient team.

If you want to request voucher codes, fill out the form linked here.

If you’re going to take the exam, don’t forget to check out the practice exam, too!

This sounds great @Drew_B and we really appreciate the support that Onshape gives to FIRST and teams.
For those of us not in the know, what does having an Onshape Associate Certification mean? I have a few students who seem to be very fluent with Onshape and if this certification can help them in anyway, I’d love to let them know that this is a thing.
Thanks!

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-05-12T17:45:41.942Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":298,"readers_count":297,"score":89.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":501608,"topic_slug":"onshape-associate-cert-exam-codes-in-virtual-kop","display_username":"Chris Cross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38318,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Neither cool nor super."},"post_url":"/t/onshape-associate-cert-exam-codes-in-virtual-kop/501608/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3622108,"name":"Drew B.","username":"Drew_B","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/drew_b/{size}/194417_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-12T18:20:16.284Z","cooked":"

Great question. The Onshape Associate Certification establishes that a user has strong proficiencies in part modeling, basic assembly design, and drawing knowledge. The exam was built to test users on the skills that an entry-level design engineer will need if they want to hit the ground running in a design role. It’s also an industry-recognized certification and is listed in multiple different states.

With how competitive college and internship applications are nowadays, earning certifications like this is one more way for a student to stand out.

I’m sure that someone else is much more knowledgeable about this than I am, but here is a link to a page explaining the certification.
Certified Onshape Associate Exam

Yes, there is. The Certified Onshape Associate page in the Learning Center has a list of topics as well as a some recommended courses in the Learning Center. If a given student or mentor can cruise through those LC courses with ease, they’ll be fine for the exam. The practice exam documentation also dives pretty heavily into the specifics of each section and what skills are needed for each.

In my own experience, the biggest reason why users have not passed the exam is due to time. They know the necessary steps, but have not spent enough time using Onshape to quickly work through each question. I’ve also seen plenty of FRC students cruise through the 3-hour exam in well under 2 hours.
